Subject: Bugzilla Bug 116959 - Deployment to Oracle 10g Rel 2 ias OC4J

Antonio,

The BIRT bugzilla bug 116959 (Deployment to Oracle 10g Rel 2 ias OC4J) you reported was resolved. I just tested M3 build and it works fine on my machine. For your reference, here are the test steps I did.

1. Download the latest OC4J from http://www.oracle.com/technology/software/htdocs/eaplic.html?http://download.oracle.com/otn/java/oc4j/1013/preview/oc4j_extended_1013_dp4.zip. The version I'm using is 10g (10.1.3.0.0) - Developer Preview 4 (build 050723.1217.03158). I strongly suggest you use 10.1.3 instead of 10.1.2, because 10.1.3 has a very powerful deployment UI which makes deployment much easier than 10.1.2. You can simply type http://<oc4j_host>:8888/em to access the deployment UI (Enterprise Manager).

2. Unzip OC4j and follow the readme.txt to set it up. I'm using JDK 1.4.2 (build 1.4.2_05-b04).

3. Get BIRT M3 build (runtime) from http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/birt/downloads/drops/M-R1-2.0M3-200512011059/birt-runtime-2.0M3.zip. Unzip it and get the birt.war in it.

4. Start OC4j and login Enterprise Manager (http://<oc4j_host>:8888/em)

5. Go to Application Tab and click Deploy, and deploy the birt.war we got in step 3. BIRT is deployed successfully.

6. Go to http://<oc4j_host>:8888/birt/ and click the test report. It works fine. Specify the absolute location of another BIRT report in the URL. The new BIRT report is also displayed correctly.

Please give it a try in your environment and let me know if you still have problems. 

I'm going to mark this bug as Resolved. Thanks for reporting this issue.

Kai Shen
BIRT Committer
